intro: Pseudobombax petropolitanum, commonly known as the São Paulo rosewood, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy pink or red flowers. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptical in shape. It produces woody capsules as fruit, containing numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
